citances.sentence: The trader's reputation can be established even though purchasers of the goods do not know its name or have its name in mind when they purchase the goods. If the applicant's get-up has acquired a distinctive reputation, a respondent's use of the name or get-up conveys the misrepresentation that the goods are the applicant's, thereby harming the applicant's goodwill: Ricegrowers Ltd v Real Foods Pty Ltd [2008] FCA 639 ; (2008) 77 IPR 32 at 44-45.
